When issue indexing is in progress returns 503 service unavailable HTTP code.

parameters.name: additionalFields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of the optional fields to be returned in response. Action plans are dropped in 5.5, it is not returned in the response.

parameters.name: asc
parameters.description: Ascending sort

parameters.name: assigned
parameters.description: To retrieve assigned or unassigned issues

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of assignee logins. The value '__me__' can be used as a placeholder for user who performs the request

parameters.description: SCM accounts. To set several values, the parameter must be called once for each value.

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of Clean Code Attribute Categories

parameters.name: codeVariants
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of code variants.

parameters.name: components
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of component keys. Retrieve issues associated to a specific list of components (and all its descendants). A component can be a portfolio, project, module, directory or file.

parameters.name: createdAfter
parameters.description:
To retrieve issues created after the given date (inclusive).
Either a date (use 'timeZone' attribute or it will default to server timezone) or datetime can be provided.
If this parameter is set, createdInLast must not be set

parameters.name: createdAt
parameters.description: Datetime to retrieve issues created during a specific analysis

parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description:
To retrieve issues created before the given date (exclusive).
Either a date (use 'timeZone' attribute or it will default to server timezone) or datetime can be provided.

parameters.name: createdInLast
parameters.description: To retrieve issues created during a time span before the current time (exclusive). Accepted units are 'y' for year, 'm' for month, 'w' for week and 'd' for day. If this parameter is set, createdAfter must not be set

parameters.name: cwe
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of CWE identifiers. Use 'unknown' to select issues not associated to any CWE.

parameters.name: facets
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of the facets to be computed. No facet is computed by default.

parameters.name: fixedInPullRequest
parameters.description: Pull request id to filter issues that would be fixed in the specified project or branch by the pull request. Should not be used together with + 'pullRequest'. At least the 'components' must be be specified when this param is used.  Not available in the community edition.

parameters.name: impactSeverities
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of Software Quality Severities

parameters.name: impactSoftwareQualities
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of Software Qualities

parameters.name: inNewCodePeriod
parameters.description:
To retrieve issues created in the new code period.
If this parameter is set to a truthy value, createdAfter must not be set and one component uuid or key must be provided.

parameters.name: issues
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of issue keys

parameters.name: languages
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of languages. Available since 4.4

parameters.name: onComponentOnly
parameters.description: Return only issues at a component's level, not on its descendants (modules, directories, files, etc). This parameter is only considered when componentKeys is set.

post.description:
Updates the new code definition on different levels:
  • Not providing a project key and a branch key will update the default value at global level. Existing projects or branches having a specific new code definition will not be impacted
  • Project key must be provided to update the value for a project
  • Both project and branch keys must be provided to update the value for a branch
Requires one of the following permissions:
  • 'Administer System' to change the global setting
  • 'Administer' rights on the specified project to change the project setting

  • 'Execute analysis' rights on the specified component

get.description:
Get the list of all the plugins available for installation on the SonarQube instance, sorted by plugin name.
Plugin information is retrieved from Update Center. Date and time at which Update Center was last refreshed is provided in the response.
Update status values are:
  • COMPATIBLE: plugin is compatible with current SonarQube instance.
  • INCOMPATIBLE: plugin is not compatible with current SonarQube instance.
  • REQUIRES_SYSTEM_UPGRADE: plugin requires SonarQube to be upgraded before being installed.
  • DEPS_REQUIRE_SYSTEM_UPGRADE: at least one plugin on which the plugin is dependent requires SonarQube to be upgraded.
Require 'Administer System' permission.

post.description:
Cancels any operation pending on any plugin (install, update or uninstall)
Requires user to be authenticated with Administer System permissions

Plugin information is retrieved from Update Center.

Requires user to be authenticated with Administer System permissions

get.description:
Display the database migration status of SonarQube.
State values are:
  • NO_MIGRATION: DB is up to date with current version of SonarQube.
  • NOT_SUPPORTED: Migration is not supported on embedded databases.
  • MIGRATION_RUNNING: DB migration is under go.
  • MIGRATION_SUCCEEDED: DB migration has run and has been successful.
  • MIGRATION_FAILED: DB migration has run and failed. SonarQube must be restarted in order to retry a DB migration (optionally after DB has been restored from backup).
  • MIGRATION_REQUIRED: DB migration is required.

Provide health status of SonarQube.

Although global health is calculated based on both application and search nodes, detailed information is returned only for application nodes.

  • GREEN: SonarQube is fully operational
  • YELLOW: SonarQube is usable, but it needs attention in order to be fully operational
  • RED: SonarQube is not operational


Requires the 'Administer System' permission or system passcode (see WEB_SYSTEM_PASS_CODE in sonar.properties).
When SonarQube is in safe mode (waiting or running a database upgrade), only the authentication with a system passcode is supported.

post.description:
Migrate the database to match the current version of SonarQube.
Sending a POST request to this URL starts the DB migration. It is strongly advised to make a database backup before invoking this WS.
State values are:
  • NO_MIGRATION: DB is up to date with current version of SonarQube.
  • NOT_SUPPORTED: Migration is not supported on embedded databases.
  • MIGRATION_RUNNING: DB migration is under go.
  • MIGRATION_SUCCEEDED: DB migration has run and has been successful.
  • MIGRATION_FAILED: DB migration has run and failed. SonarQube must be restarted in order to retry a DB migration (optionally after DB has been restored from backup).
  • MIGRATION_REQUIRED: DB migration is required.

get.description: Answers "pong" as plain-text

post.description: Restarts server. Requires 'Administer System' permission. Performs a full restart of the Web, Search and Compute Engine Servers processes. Does not reload sonar.properties.

get.description:
Get state information about SonarQube.

status: the running status

  • STARTING: SonarQube Web Server is up and serving some Web Services (eg. api/system/status) but initialization is still ongoing
  • UP: SonarQube instance is up and running
  • DOWN: SonarQube instance is up but not running because migration has failed (refer to WS /api/system/migrate_db for details) or some other reason (check logs).
  • RESTARTING: SonarQube instance is still up but a restart has been requested (refer to WS /api/system/restart for details).
  • DB_MIGRATION_NEEDED: database migration is required. DB migration can be started using WS /api/system/migrate_db.
  • DB_MIGRATION_RUNNING: DB migration is running (refer to WS /api/system/migrate_db for details)

get.description:
Get a list of users. By default, only active users are returned.
The following fields are only returned when user has Administer System permission or for logged-in in user :
  • 'email'
  • 'externalIdentity'
  • 'externalProvider'
  • 'groups'
  • 'lastConnectionDate'
  • 'sonarLintLastConnectionDate'
  • 'tokensCount'
Field 'lastConnectionDate' is only updated every hour, so it may not be accurate, for instance when a user authenticates many times in less than one hour.

parameters.name: deactivated
parameters.description: Return deactivated users instead of active users

parameters.name: externalIdentity
parameters.description:
Find a user by its external identity (ie. its login in the Identity Provider).
This is case sensitive and only available with Administer System permission.

parameters.name: lastConnectedAfter
parameters.description:
Filter the users based on the last connection date field.
Only users who interacted with this instance at or after the date will be returned.
The format must be ISO 8601 datetime format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:sshhmm)

parameters.name: lastConnectedBefore
parameters.description:
Filter the users based on the last connection date field.
Only users that never connected or who interacted with this instance at or before the date will be returned.
The format must be ISO 8601 datetime format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:sshhmm)

parameters.name: managed
parameters.description: Return managed or non-managed users. Only available for managed instances, throws for non-managed instances.

parameters.name: p
parameters.description: 1-based page number

parameters.name: ps
parameters.description: Page size. Must be greater than 0 and less or equal than 500

parameters.name: q
parameters.description:
Filter on login, name and email.
This parameter can either perform an exact match, or a partial match (contains), it is case insensitive.

parameters.name: slLastConnectedAfter
parameters.description:
Filter the users based on the sonar lint last connection date field
Only users who interacted with this instance using SonarLint at or after the date will be returned.
The format must be ISO 8601 datetime format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:sshhmm)

parameters.name: slLastConnectedBefore
parameters.description:
Filter the users based on the sonar lint last connection date field.
Only users that never connected or who interacted with this instance using SonarLint at or before the date will be returned.
The format must be ISO 8601 datetime format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:sshhmm)

New code definitions of the following types are allowed:
  • SPECIFIC_ANALYSIS - can be set at branch level only
  • PREVIOUS_VERSION - can be set at any level (global, project, branch)
  • NUMBER_OF_DAYS - can be set at any level (global, project, branch)
  • REFERENCE_BRANCH - can only be set for projects and branches

  • a number between 1 and 90, when type is NUMBER_OF_DAYS
  • a string, when type is REFERENCE_BRANCH

sonarsourceSecurity.description: Comma-separated list of SonarSource security categories. Use 'others' to select rules not associated with any category

tags.description: Comma-separated list of tags. Returned rules match any of the tags (OR operator)

targetKey.description: Quality Profile key on which the rule activation is done. To retrieve a quality profile key please see api/qualityprofiles/search

targetSeverity.description: Severity to set on the activated rules

template_key.description: Key of the template rule to filter on. Used to search for the custom rules based on this template.

types.description: Comma-separated list of types. Returned rules match any of the tags (OR operator)

parentQualityProfile.description:
New parent profile name.
If no profile is provided, the inheritance link with current parent profile (if any) is broken, which deactivates all rules which come from the parent and are not overridden.

toName.description: Name for the new quality profile.

key.description: Quality Profile key. Can be obtained through api/qualityprofiles/search

activation.description: Filter rules that are activated or deactivated on the selected Quality profile. Ignored if the parameter 'qprofile' is not set.

active_severities.description: Comma-separated list of activation severities, i.e the severity of rules in Quality profiles.

available_since.description: Filters rules added since date. Format is yyyy-MM-dd

cleanCodeAttributeCategories.description: Comma-separated list of Clean Code Attribute Categories

cwe.description: Comma-separated list of CWE identifiers. Use 'unknown' to select rules not associated to any CWE.

impactSeverities.description: Comma-separated list of Software Quality Severities

inheritance.description: Comma-separated list of values of inheritance for a rule within a quality profile. Used only if the parameter 'activation' is set.

owaspTop10.description: Comma-separated list of OWASP Top 10 2017 lowercase categories.

owaspTop10-2021.description: Comma-separated list of OWASP Top 10 2021 lowercase categories.

qprofile.description: Quality profile key to filter on. Used only if the parameter 'activation' is set.

rule_key.description: Key of rule to search for

sansTop25.description: Comma-separated list of SANS Top 25 categories.

severities.description: Comma-separated list of default severities. Not the same than severity of rules in Quality profiles.

sonarsourceSecurity.description: Comma-separated list of SonarSource security categories. Use 'others' to select rules not associated with any category

tags.description: Comma-separated list of tags. Returned rules match any of the tags (OR operator)

targetKey.description: Quality Profile key on which the rule deactivation is done. To retrieve a profile key please see api/qualityprofiles/search

template_key.description: Key of the template rule to filter on. Used to search for the custom rules based on this template.

types.description: Comma-separated list of types. Returned rules match any of the tags (OR operator)

key.description: Quality profile key

backup.description: A profile backup file in XML format, as generated by api/qualityprofiles/backup or the former api/profiles/backup.

preventReactivation.description: If set to true and if the rule has been deactivated (status 'REMOVED'), a status 409 will be returned

templateKey.description: Key of the template rule in order to create a custom rule

key.description: Rule key
Key of the rule to update

markdownDescription.description: Rule description (mandatory for custom rule and manual rule) in markdown format

markdown_note.description: Optional note in markdown format. Use empty value to remove current note. Note is not changed if the parameter is not set.

params.description: Parameters as semi-colon list of <key>=<value>, for example 'params=key1=v1;key2=v2' (Only when updating a custom rule)

remediation_fn_base_effort.description: Base effort of the remediation function of the rule

remediation_fn_type.description: Type of the remediation function of the rule

remediation_fy_gap_multiplier.description: Gap multiplier of the remediation function of the rule

severity.description: Rule severity (Only when updating a custom rule)

status.description: Rule status (Only when updating a custom rule)

tags.description: Optional comma-separated list of tags to set. Use blank value to remove current tags. Tags are not changed if the parameter is not set.

component.description: Component key. Only keys for projects, applications, portfolios or subportfolios are accepted.
Component key. Only keys for projects, applications, portfolios or subportfolios are accepted.

fieldValues.description: Setting field values. To set several values, the parameter must be called once for each value.

key.description: Setting key

value.description: Setting value. To reset a value, please use the reset web service.

values.description: Setting multi value. To set several values, the parameter must be called once for each value.

level.description: The new level. Be cautious: DEBUG, and even more TRACE, may have performance impacts.

description.description: Description for the new group. A group description cannot be larger than 200 characters.

name.description: Name for the new group. A group name cannot be larger than 255 characters and must be unique. The value 'anyone' (whatever the case) is reserved and cannot be used.

currentName.description: Name of the group to be updated.

description.description: New optional description for the group. A group description cannot be larger than 200 characters. If value is not defined, then description is not changed.

name.description: New optional name for the group. A group name cannot be larger than 255 characters and must be unique. Value 'anyone' (whatever the case) is reserved and cannot be used. If value is empty or not defined, then name is not changed.

expirationDate.description: The expiration date of the token being generated, in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD). If not set, default to no expiration.

login.description: User login. If not set, the token is generated for the authenticated user.

projectKey.description: The key of the only project that can be analyzed by the PROJECT_ANALYSIS_TOKEN being generated.

type.description: Token Type. If this parameters is set to PROJECT_ANALYSIS_TOKEN, it is necessary to provide the projectKey parameter too.

previousPassword.description: Previous password. Required when changing one's own password.

local.description: Specify if the user should be authenticated from SonarQube server or from an external authentication system. Password should not be set when local is set to false.

password.description: User password. Only mandatory when creating local user, otherwise it should not be set

scmAccount.description: List of SCM accounts. To set several values, the parameter must be called once for each value.

anonymize.description: Anonymize user in addition to deactivating it

scmAccount.description: SCM accounts. To set several values, the parameter must be called once for each value.

newExternalIdentity.description: New external identity, usually the login used in the authentication system. If not provided previous identity will be used.

newExternalProvider.description: New external provider. Only authentication system installed are available. Use 'LDAP' identity provider for single server LDAP setup.Use 'LDAP_{serverKey}' identity provider for multiple LDAP servers setup.

newLogin.description: The new login. It must not already exist.

portfolio.description: Key of the portfolio where the application will be added

name.description: Name displayed in the administration console of webhooks

project.description: The key of the project that will own the webhook

secret.description: If provided, secret will be used as the key to generate the HMAC hex (lowercase) digest value in the 'X-Sonar-Webhook-HMAC-SHA256' header

url.description: Server endpoint that will receive the webhook payload, for example 'http://my_server/foo'. If HTTP Basic authentication is used, HTTPS is recommended to avoid man in the middle attacks. Example: 'https://myLogin:myPassword@my_server/foo'

webhook.description: The key of the webhook to be deleted, auto-generated value can be obtained through api/webhooks/create or api/webhooks/list

secret.description: If provided, secret will be used as the key to generate the HMAC hex (lowercase) digest value in the 'X-Sonar-Webhook-HMAC-SHA256' header. If blank, any secret previously configured will be removed. If not set, the secret will remain unchanged.

url.description: new url to be called by the webhook

webhook.description: The key of the webhook to be updated, auto-generated value can be obtained through api/webhooks/create or api/webhooks/list
